data.title: Android crashing on first launch
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: Nexus 7 (2012) with Android 5.1.1  and Samsung Galaxy Alpha with Android 5.0.2
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1

On first start of application, it crashes with the following log:

02-13 17:53:11.909 122-122/? I/DEBUG: Revision: '0'
02-13 17:53:11.909 122-122/? I/DEBUG: ABI: 'arm'
02-13 17:53:11.909 122-122/? I/DEBUG: pid: 24807, tid: 25863, name: GLThread 1159  >>> com.protectfive.cocos2dx.sample <<<
02-13 17:53:11.910 122-122/? I/DEBUG: signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x20
02-13 17:53:11.939 122-122/? I/DEBUG: backtrace:
02-13 17:53:11.940 122-122/? I/DEBUG:     #00 pc 00788130  /data/app/com.protectfive.cocos2dx.sample-1/lib/arm/libMyGame.so (cocos2d::GLProgram::reset()+48)
02-13 17:53:11.940 122-122/? I/DEBUG:     #01 pc 00791948  /data/app/com.protectfive.cocos2dx.sample-1/lib/arm/libMyGame.so (cocos2d::GLProgramCache::reloadDefaultGLPrograms()+2652)
02-13 17:53:11.940 122-122/? I/DEBUG:     #02 pc 0052d4e1  /data/app/com.protectfive.cocos2dx.sample-1/lib/arm/libMyGame.so (Java_org_cocos2dx_lib_Cocos2dxRenderer_nativeInit+184)

The following launches, the app is working fine.

On first launch, the app downloads an obb file (native Android Activity) from google play, and after validating the download, it starts the Cocos2dxActivity.

I'm compiling the project with the following Android.mk file:

APP_STL := gnustl_static
APP_CPPFLAGS := -frtti -DCC_ENABLE_CHIPMUNK_INTEGRATION=1 -std=c++11 -fsigned-char
APP_LDFLAGS := -latomic
APP_ABI := armeabi-v7a arm64-v8a x86
ifeq ($(NDK_DEBUG),1)
  APP_CPPFLAGS += -DCOCOS2D_DEBUG=1
  APP_OPTIM := debug
else
  APP_CPPFLAGS += -DNDEBUG
  APP_OPTIM := release
endif

How can I fix this problem? How can I find out what produces the crash?

Thanks!

data.title: remove duplicate member variables in EditBoxImplCommon

data.title: 17357: Better encapsulate the definition of mouse buttons
data.body:
Move definition of buttons from a list of #define's to an enum class and made appropriate updates for successful compilation.

Built on linux only at this stage, work spawned from #17357, see there for more discussion for the reasons for the change.

data.title: Better encapsulate the definition of mouse buttons
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: Linux
- developing environments
   - NDK version: NA
   - Xcode version: NA
   - VS version: NA
   - browser type and version: NA

This issue is to propose a design adjustment to ``EventMouse`` so that it exposes the definition of a mouse button as an ``enum class`` instead of raw ``#define``'s (for the obvious beneficial reasons).  The result of the change is that clients receiving mouse click events will need to handle a ``EventMouse::MouseButton`` type rather than a raw int. The benefit of this is that the type of the mouse button will be immediately obvious, the downside being that existing code will need to be updated to handle the type (this is trivial though e.g. static_cast<int>).

This new issue was triggered by discussion on #8414.

As an aside; Cocos2dx uses GLFW3 for its input handling and the current defined button values are a copy paste from there to the existing ``#define``'s. From a clients point of view however they shouldn't be exposed to the fact that GLFW is being used, so that if a new input system is used at some point in the future then it can be swapped out without causing unnecessary pain.

data.title: Content size in ui::Button becomes 0, 0
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a ui::Button without an image (ui::Button::create())
2. call setContentSize and set some size

contentSize will soon become 0, 0 again. I don't know what exactly causes that. 
I moved to Node and this ain't happening anymore. 
I suspect there's something in ui::Button code which checks if there's no texture it resest content size to 0. This for example can cause to problem to detect touches and changing anchor points.

data.title: ui::PageViewIndicator rendering glitch
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1, and latest git version
- devices test on:
- developing environments
   - Linux, GCC version: 6.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new C++ project and replace `HelloWorldScene.cpp` with the attached code: [HelloWorldScene_cpp.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/768814/HelloWorldScene_cpp.txt)
2. Compile and run.
3. Note that only two items where pushed into `page_view`. When both, `ui::PageView::setIndicatorIndexNodesScale` and `ui::PageView::setIndicatorSpaceBetweenIndexNodes` are called in that specific order, a third indicator will appear temporarily. Moving to the next page will make the indicator disappear. The spacing between the indicator nodes seems to be wrong too.

- Temporary solution:
    - Calling `ui::PageView::setIndicatorSpaceBetweenIndexNodes` first and then `ui::PageView::setIndicatorIndexNodesScale` will prevent the extra indicator from appearing.

data.title: Why does 'EditBoxImplCommon' have the same member variable with 'EditBox'?
Android app is killed in low memory scenario (very large texture cache)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: Motorola Moto G 2014 (CyanogenMod), Sony Xperia
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version: N/A
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Across several Scenes, load and display large textures
2. Over time, the texture cache fills up and eventually the Android app is killed due to low memory

Our app has several large images (basically full screen textures) we were using across different scenes. We are experiencing crashes on lower end devices that seem directly related to memory usage. An examination of `adb log` just shows the message: `process has died`. There's no signal sent to the debbuger -- no actual crash occurs. The OS just kills the app because of excess memory usage.

On the Java side, I added custom callbacks to `onTrimMemory` which make a call through the JNI to Cocos to call `removeUnusedTextures` in the texture cache. Although it seems to help a small amount, the problem is not fixed. The app will still be killed randomly.

What I think would help tremendously would be some kind of limit on how large the texture cache could get. Instead of continually loading textures in, it would only keep textures in the cache up to a memory limit and after that point it would continually release the least-recently-used texture until it was able to load the requested texture.

I will look into implementing such a feature, but wanted to create the issue in case other people are having a similar problem with their app.

data.title: Some fixes for websocket
data.body:
* libwebsockets & curl are dynamic libraries now, modify project configuration for win32.
* Corrects some logic in WebSocket.cpp, each ws connection will create a virutal host now.
* Adds wss test case. WebSocketTest suggests developers to use `WebSocket::closeAsync` method which will not block current thread.
* Allows self-assign cert.

data.title: Fix tizen compilation issue
data.body:
1. change appid from `org.tizen` to `org.cocos2d-x` in all the tests file and project template file.
2. bump the 3rd party deps to 122 with websockets and openssl update
3. fix compilation issues
4. enable websockets tests on Tizen
